fields.summary: document how to Exclude Weekends from Cycle Time calculations
add more issues types to Issue Detail View - label, radio etc

fields.description:
NB. Also add to Keyboard Shortcuts??

Quickly Rank Issues and Assign to (& remove from) Sprint; Bulk Change Multiple Issues; View in Issue Navigator
fields.summary: document Issue Actions
Upcoming sprint name inline edit submits on click when it shouldn't

fields.description: It would be great to able to view commit data in the Agile issue detail pane (perhaps with the comments or as a new tab), rather than having to leave the Agile view and go to the Issue Detail page.
fields.summary: Show commits in Agile issue detail pane

fields.description:
As an user I want to use Epics on Kanban Board

COS
- -Add/Edit/Delete Epics- shipped with JSW-6175
- -Assign issues (stories, bugs etc) to Epics- shipped with JSW-6175
- Visualize & Track Epic Progress
- Epic Reports

This user story might be an Epic in fact :)
fields.summary: Kanban Epics Support

fields.description:
Can you add the ability to add a sprint between existing sprints in the Greenhopper scrum planning view. We are using the sprints also as buckets for projects further out and only for the next couple of sprints we then pull from the buckets for proper planning. At the moment, when we create a new sprint between the general "buckets" and the series of sprints for teh weeks ahead we need to create a new sprint at the very bottom and then move the items from the previous sprint to the new sprint, and from the sprint before that to the previously last sprint etc. Very tedious. 

While doing this would be fantastic if you could make all sprints, not just the current active spring collapsible. Would make moving around much faster given that new items always fall to the very end of the backlog.
fields.summary: Allow to add sprints between existing sprints

fields.description:
It would be good if we could see the Version Control tab in the Card View and not only in the issue details.
Today, we need to open the issue to check this information, there is no way to see this in the Work mode details.
fields.summary: Version Control tab in the Card View

fields.description:
This error systematically occurs if the Epic is closed in JIRA. 

From a JIRA Admin point of view I understand why this is happening and I agree not to allow updating closed JIRA issues (default JIRA behaviour).

However from a GH/JIRA User point of view, the error message does not make sense and I am confused as why we have separate "Epic Status" and JIRA issue "Status" fields.
fields.summary: Epic "Mark as Done" gives an Error: "You do not have permission to edit issues in this project."

fields.description: lets overlay it in the position that the pencil icon normally occupies rather than push page content down.
fields.summary: inline edit "save" spinner pushes the page down

fields.description:
In 6.0-breakit-SNAPSHOT since Jan 3rd, last unaffected version is 6.0-m04, ActionUtil, ActionNames, possibly ActionDispatcher and other related code has been removed.

GreenHopper uses this code in classic board fields to update field values, e.g. set the assignee, component, version etc.

To fix it, we'll have to replace all update code to use proper JIRA api. See the deprecated messages in ActionNames on what to replace the code with.
fields.summary: GH code fixes required for latest 6.0-breakit version

fields.description: It would be great if custom JIRA fields could be added to the Issue Details View, similar to how default JIRA fields can be added.  For example, we use a 'reviewer' field that would be great to be able to check at a glance.
fields.summary: Add custom fields to Issue Details View

fields.description:
When viewing the Cumulative Flow Diagram for a sprint it appears to show all issues where {{sprint is not EMPTY}}, i.e. the issue is currently in, or has been in a sprint. It would be nice if the _Refine..._ option had a button to show where {{sprint in openSprints()}}, i.e. just the current sprint.

The rationale for this is that the _Plan_ view shows all issues that match the board filter. The _Work_ view shows all issues that match the board filter and are in the current sprint. The CFD chart shows a data set that neither of these views display.
fields.summary: Add a filter for the current Sprint in the CFD

fields.description:
The documentation state the following:
{quote}A Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) is an area chart that shows *work-in-progress* for a product, version or sprint. The horizontal x-axis in a CFD indicates time, and the vertical y-axis indicates cards (issues). Each coloured area of the chart equates to a workflow status (i.e. a column on your board).{quote}
From the above, it is understand that CFD should show the work-in-progress for a sprint whereby it should show the current sprint. However, in GreenHopper 6.1.0, it does not behave that way. The current behaviour for CFD is with the filter of {{Sprint is not EMPTY}}. Suprisingly, it is the same as what ["Anonymous" commented/requested|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Chart?focusedCommentId=311034351#comment-311034351] to have the reports showing the entire relase and not only the current sprint.

Please update the documentation to the correct and expected behaviour for Cumulative Flow Diagram as this brings confusions to both sides.
fields.summary: Update docs on Cumulative Flow Diagram

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to be still able to drag and drop issues to the 'Epics' or 'Sprints' in case the board's ranking is disabled
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be still able to drag and drop issues to the 'Epics' or 'Sprints' in case the board's ranking is disabled

fields.description: As discussed between Tom, Jay and Martin
fields.summary: Improve spacing between items in the epic panel

fields.description: As discussed between Tom, Jay and Martin
fields.summary: "Create issue" should say "Create issue in epic" in the epic panel

fields.description: As discussed between Tom, Jay and Martin
fields.summary: Use ADG/Tipsy and increase the focus area for the epic tooltip

fields.description:
The ability to be able to create a swimlane by any of the fields configured for a project (or accumulation of projects), including the project names  would make the boards much more flexible.

For example swimlane by project (if more than one project selected), or swimlane by version, component etc - would scan the fields, and provided number of unique entries is less than a fixed amount (say 10 or whatever is appropriate for performance) would allow that field to be selected as the swimlane filter.

This would work well for boards which accumulate multiple projects into one. Then, as new projects get added, swimlanes automatically expand. For example, multiple projects, each with their own sprints - an accumulated kanban board could have swimlanes by sprints, which keeps expanding as more projects are added (or subtracted).
fields.summary: More dynamic swimlines

fields.description:
The inline edit hover box is a certain width, but when we click it we change to a box of a different width.

Also when you click inline edit on an issue title, we change position and font size, can we make it more like the behaviour of changing a sprint name, where the appearance of the typography is relatively constant.

In general just trying to feel like edit mode is editing the same thing they clicked on instead of hiding it and giving them something else to edit (which is actually what is happening).
fields.summary: Inline Edit jumpiness
Update swimlane headers and swimlane stalker/name from gradient to flat colour

fields.description:
The Plan mode nicely shows the total of the estimates for the sprint, while in Work mode this information is not visible. If the summary of the estimates can be shown for each of the columns in the work mode, it will be a great value addition to see what is pending in each of the columns.

Created from the Answers post https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/116803/showing-time-remaining-and-quick-filters
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see the total of estimates on columns in Work mode
Allow closing of detail view in Plan mode when intro text shown
Publish a public Database Schema to explain the table and how the data is being stored

fields.description:
Hi, in the new rapid boards, moving the last of a series of subtasks will create a pop-up (Update Parent) asking if you also want to move the parent issue to done.

As well as this is meant, most if not all POs I work with prefer to close the parent issues themselves, while subtasks are closed by the team members.

Could you please make it configurable, so we can switch off this dialog if desired?

Thanks a lot on behalf of several of my clients and myself,
Jasper
fields.summary: Please enable me to switch off the 'Update Parent' dialig

fields.description: placeholder todo to look at the user journeys with old epics in JIRA to new epics in GH.
fields.summary: Reconcile "traditional" epics with "new" epics

fields.description: As of now, the listing of *Rapid Board* is being determined by the most recent boards that are being used as mentioned in the [As a user I would like the Agile drop down to provide favorite Rapid Views|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-1859] request. However, is it possible to have an additional option to choose which board can be listed on the drop-down menu? Perhaps to have some sort of order that the user configure to set a particular to be listed first, second, and so on?
fields.summary: Ability to set the order listing of Rapid Board from the Agile drop-down menu

fields.description: e.g. if you go to https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=96&view=planning, (i.e. open without specifying the task), then the "t" shortcut doesn't work
fields.summary: 'press t to hide detail view' doesn't work if an issue is not selected

fields.description: Right now only text, number, date field types are support to be shown in the item detail view (on the right). It'd be great if all other types (such as radio button, etc.) would be supported too.
fields.summary: Issue Detail View - support more types of custom fields

fields.description: In the new Epic feature, as a user, I want to know the Epic name on the stories associated with the Epic (I know that can be possible by enabling the Epic Link but Epic Name would be better since is more convenient for the user)
fields.summary: As a user, I want to know the Epic name on the stories associated with the Epic

With distributed Scrum teams it's a good idea if you are able to view when other users are working/making changes on GreenHopper.

This is similar to multiple users that can view and edit Google Documents.
fields.summary: Add the ability to see the users that are working on an Agile board
Rank to top/bottom in the view issue page does not show a success message

fields.description:
Could be caused by GHS-7007

It looks like the guideline calculation doesn't cater for the case where the sprint end date is before "now", resulting in the guideline finishing in the correct sprint end point, but using incorrect decrement delta for the previous working day blocks
fields.summary: Burndown guideline with non working day segments incorrectly calculated

fields.description:
Something in the data model is incorrectly updated. Subsequent parent rank operations place the parent at the wrong location. This might also be the source for rogue board updated messages showing up.

How to reproduce
1. Rank a parent (having a subtask) to the last position
2. Rank another issue at the end

Outcome: The issue is placed between the parent and its subs.
Expected: The issue is placed after the subs
fields.summary: Ranking with subtasks incorrectly updates the board

-user is able to configure the fields displayed on cards
-user is able to determine the character length printed on cards for each field

As a greenhopper 6 rapid board user I want a "view issues" in JIRA on sprints that have not been started yet so that I can export these excel
GreenHopper version in XML export wrong

Currently:

fields.description:
See screenshot. I had marked Saturdays and Sundays as non-working days. The sprint is not yet completed, so it is going beyond its projected end date.

Specific non-working days are also affected i.e. they are not drawn if outside the range of the sprint dates.
fields.summary: Non working day regions are not shaded outside of sprint start date and projected end date, when sprint is not completed

fields.description: When we run out of work in the Active Sprint, we will bring Stories from the top of the Backlog into the Active Sprint. It would be great if GreenHopper would advise us if these Stories are not yet estimated prior to allowing them to enter the Sprint.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I would like GreenHopper to remind me that tasks we are adding to an Active Sprint are not yet estimated
Detail view avatar alignment in boxy browsers

See screenshot which compares left margin of:
* Fields in Details section
* Description field content
* Comments
fields.summary: OPINION - alignment of various detail view things
Status mapping - When user cannot perform action we should probably not show it in description

fields.description: My original thought was that I would be able to set it in the workflow.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to allow issues to be added to a sprint on issue creation.

fields.description:
When using plan mode, I don't see auto-refresh occuring when ranking issues or status changes. 
To reproduce:

# Set up JIRA and GH
# Prepare a Project, some test Issues, and a Scrum board
# Verify drag-and drop ranking works
# Clone or duplicate the tab so you have two views of the same board
# Change rank or status of an issue
# Switch to the other window
# No auto-refresh occurs

To help remote teams plan, auto refresh would be great addition to the product.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Plan Mode to auto-refresh

fields.description: 4px left, should be 3?
fields.summary: Project icon in detail view slightly misaligned

fields.description:
There are some differences in our project creation dialog to the JIRA one.

* Remove "Project" from "Name" and "Key" field labels
* Standardise on field descriptions for Name and Key (maximum length)
** Enforce maximum lengths on those fields
fields.summary: Align project creation dialog to JIRA style

fields.description: Consider replacement of green welcome box with a Share feature (as seen in JIRA for sharing an issue, Conf for sharing a page).
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to share a board so I can more easily collaborate with my team

fields.description: How do the modifications that GreenHopper makes to JIRA objects and relationships get manifested in JIRA?
fields.summary: GreenHopper / JIRA UI Integration

fields.description:
Just installed Greenhopper again after 1,5 yrs break. That whole SCRUM-Kanban boards thing is not quite what I expected. I think previous versions (with JIRA 4.3 if my memory serves me well) was more intuitive. Why Kanban doesn't have a burndown chart? Why can't I create new cards in Kanban board as freely as in classic one? SCRUM board may be good for SCRUM teams, but for others it's enforcing alien methodology. But only SCRUM board has burndown chart... I can't understand reasoning behind such decision.

I use greenhopper for "casual projects" - projects with very limited spare resources. For "casual project" to stay alive the only thing is needed - steady progress. Classic boards allow me to plan ahead release of next version and tie it to exact date i.e. next meeting. There are always much more features out there than I can implement with what resources I have now. Burndown chart in classic boards of greenhopper helps me release new version within deadline with all features possible. As long as I'm comfortible with required burndown rate, I can freely plan new features.
Attached is my typical burndown chart for "casual project".

So long story short, I want to have classic burndown chart in Kanban board.
"+ New card" button in kanban board would be nice bonus too.
fields.summary: Preserving functionality of classic boards

fields.description:
From the Atlassian documentation: "You can only create a new sprint if you have the 'Administer Projects' permission in all projects included in the current board's filter."
I guess there is a good reason for this restriction, could you please explain why it exists?
We have cases where a user would like to create a Sprint on a "wide" Board, i.e. a Board which sees several Projects.
Shouldn't the user be allowed to create the Sprint, and only be blocked if he or she tries to include issues from projects that he/she is not Admin for?
Or perhaps, the user should be allowed to create a Sprint regardless of having or not having project admin level permissions?
Or, should the create sprint operation have its own permission settings?
In our organization, we would like to allow certain users to create Sprints across any projects, regardless of project level admin permissions.
fields.summary: Why is creation of Sprints restricted based on project level admin permissions?

fields.description: It would be convenient, especially when we have a long list of Epics, to be able to select multiple Epics in the list, then move them altogether up or down the list.
fields.summary: When prioritizing Epics, to be able to select and move multiple Epics at once

fields.description:
When creating a project with sample data, issue 17 reads: 
Instructions for deleting this sample board and project are in the description for this issue >> Click the "JO-17" link and read the description tab of the detail view for more

This is inaccurate with the new layout for the detail view.
fields.summary: Inaccuracy in Sample Data

fields.description: With Epics being added in 6.1 I now get a very disconcerting empty space when I go and look at the planning mode of the sample scrum project. !Screen Shot 2012-12-19 at 2.11.25 PM.png! Would be good to have some sample epics there as well.
fields.summary: Add some sample epics to the sample project data

fields.description:
* Should not have ? in title
* "Sprint" should have lowercase 's'
fields.summary: OPINION - text for delete sprint confirm dialog
Identify NWD in the mini-burndown of the Sprint Report

fields.description:
- If I'm an existing user I didn't explicitly set my non working days so they could be wrong and in any case I'll initially be confused by the missing periods
- The shaded version is very powerful and no other product that I'm aware of has an approach like this that doesn't completely obscure the missing period (i.e it's a competitive differentiator we should show off)
- Work performed during the weekend period is 'lost' if I generate the report during that period, the shaded version does not lose this information
fields.summary: OPINION: The default for non working days should be to show them (reasoning in description)
Show Non-Working days checkbox should be checked by default

fields.description: Also check why the i18n key isn't translated in this case
fields.summary: Directly navigating to the chart intro page results in an incorrectly rendered actions menu
Apply longer created message time for epic creation as well as issue creation
In the Create Project and Board dialog, clicking on "learn more" replaces the current page and loses all my data

fields.description:
From https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+a+Board
{quote}Note that only the owner of a board (or a person with the 'JIRA Administrators' global permission) can modify its configuration.{quote}

Could rapid board configuration be included in the permissions schema.
This also came up in atlassian answers
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/77636/permissions-on-rapid-board-configuration
fields.summary: Set rapid board configuration in the permissions schema

fields.description:
Update projector mode where borders are not updated to higher contrast
Include epics
fields.summary: Projector mode fixes for borders +

fields.description: Flip between sprints or between charts and you'll end up with multiple messages as well as the chart axis labels
fields.summary: No working days message and chart labels drawn together

fields.description: When adding a non working day through the calendar widget, sometimes too many dates are selected. This is caused by cycling through different months / years. Only a click event should select a date
fields.summary: Selecting a non working day is returning too many dates

fields.description: When I expand an epic from the epic list on a sprint board I should be able to click on the epic key and have the details of the epic show up just like an other issue type in the details pane on the right hand side of the sprint board. Currently I have to use my browser functionality and right click on the epic key and open in another tab to see the details.
fields.summary: As a user of Agile Boards I'd like the details of an Epic to show up in the Details Pane on the right side of the board

fields.description: When you click on a quick filter, it should also filter any epics shown in the new epic list in the scrum planning mode.
fields.summary: As a User Of Agile Boards I'd Like The Epics List to Also Be Filtered By The Board Quick Filters

fields.description:
On Agile Boards: for issues displayed under active sprints, planned sprints or the backlog, it would be very useful to have a "View Issues" link which would allow users to view the active, planned or backlog issues in the issue navigator. This would allow export of the issues for printing reports, more detailed spreadsheet analysis, etc.

See attachment for example.

Currently, a workaround used is using JQL search for issues in a certain Sprint ID.
fields.summary: As a user I would like a link on the planning board to view issues in a given sprint

fields.description:
Currently, if you print the planning board (new boards, not classic), there are many errors in the rendering. For example, the first issue in a sprint, or planned sprint is missing its title. I am wondering if there are plans to make a printable version of the planning board.
Thanks
fields.summary: As user, I would like to print the Rapid Planning board

fields.description:
It would be useful for us to have a preconfigured swimlane option for projects, similar to assignees and stories. 

Since we have a fast growing number of projects it is not an option to keep adding queries manually for every new project we create.
fields.summary: As a user i would like to have a preconfigured swimlane setting for projects.

fields.description:
There is a function to determine next editable which does not expect the time-tracking estimate.

GH.DetailsFieldEditModel.prototype.getFieldInTabOrder
fields.summary: After editing Summary tabbing goes to description, then to estimate (when time-tracking is on)

fields.description:
On JIRA 5.0, gh-debug with GH 6.1.1-SNAPSHOT I reinstalled the test client plugin (also 6.1.1-SNAPSHOT) through upm to test stuff, and as a result the content of the custom tabs disappeared.

Possibly a 5.0 only web item plugin point reloadability issue.

Restarting JIRA fixes the issue.

fields.summary: Detail view tab plugin point reloadability issue

fields.description: We've been adding in field types one by one, probably should shake and settle these.
fields.summary: Config:  Fields pickers getting a little crufty

fields.description:
From a support case.

The customer had an issue type screen scheme not associated with any project or entity and we got a null pointer exception (unable to find a screen scheme associated?). GH should not fail at this line.
fields.summary: GH upgrade fails if there is an issue type screen scheme with no entities
document Epic Report

fields.description: As a Scrum Master I would like a horizontal scrollbar on GreenHopper Rapid Board as if you add too many columns on a board you don't get a scrollbar which makes each column progressively thinner (and eventually unusable).
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like a horizontal scrollbar on greenhopper Rapid Board

fields.description: As a techie user, I want to be able to quickly move issues to the top of my piles (sprint or backlog) or to quickly force rank across the entire pile with as few mouse clicks and drags as possible (I'm a developer - I hate mice!).
fields.summary: Make managing issue order on planning board (in sprints and backlog) more like managing Netflix queues

fields.description:
We have large Backlogs and very long list of Epics. I can't figure out any way of applying a filter to that long list of Epics, which is insensitive to the Quick Filters. What do we do when our list of Epics is so long that it becomes unmanageable?
Note: Using the Board main filter is not an option as we need to keep it broad, and work with Quick Filters.
fields.summary: List of Epics may get very long, we would like to see some filtering capability

fields.description: There is a current limit of 30 characters. Some of our users would like to have the Epic Name field extended.
fields.summary: Is it possible to increase the field length to which an Epic can be named?

fields.description: It does not seem to be possible to change the colour palette from which to select colors from? Current default colours are difficult to tell apart, especially for colour blind people.
fields.summary: Make Epic Label Colour palette configurable

fields.description: Also, don't bring back the enormous timezone configuration data required for the timezone selector when the user can't edit the timezone.
fields.summary: Configuration screen needs a read-only mode

fields.description:
* Epics are not visible in plan mode anymore. Even those epics which are created using the 'Create Issue' button within an Epic in the epic panel (left side of the Plan mode) are not visible.
* Add functionality to link Epics to Epics
OR
* Make the Epic functionality configurable so that the Plan mode can still see issues of type Epic
fields.summary: As a User It is Needed to have Epics Itself Visible in the Plan Mode

fields.description: Currently they are formatted in dd-mm-yyy
fields.summary: Non working days should show up in user defined format
Guideline goes back on itself when chart ends on a non-working day
GreenHopper Help Page Links shown in the Application Header Help drop-down should open in a new page / tab

fields.description: Black line separating "add" row and actual rows isn't displayed properly
fields.summary: IE8: Visual defect in restful table

fields.description: Dec 12 vs 12 Dec
fields.summary: Date labels invert when switching between showing/hiding non working days

fields.description: The chart with excluded non working days shows an incorrect x-axis. Best would be to fix up the x-axis labels
fields.summary: Burndown chart: Incorrect x axis when sprint start day is a non working day

fields.description: Show a warning message when no working days are available. currently the chart is rendered with a single x axis value
fields.summary: Burndown chart: Show warning message when no working intervals are configured

fields.description:
Velocity Chart labels do not scale
Ref https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-6839

Change to angled labels either always or when they're nearly touching
fields.summary: The sprint names get merged in the velocity chart

fields.description:
We really  like the advantages of the Epic update to the Planning Board. We'd like to be able to view and organize the Agile Board in the same manner as the Planning Board, keeping the issues and subtasks. 
Dragging the epic and/or being able to toggle the visible issues would be an awesome upgrade. 

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: As a user that can view and edit the Agile Work view, I'd like to be able to organize and view the issues with in a way similar to the planning view

fields.description:
When an Epic issue doesn't belong to a Sprint, it doesn't appear on the board, even on backlog. 

Steps to reproduce:
* Create two issues as bugs, and add one of them to a Sprint.
* Move both issues to Epic issuetype.
* The one that belongs to the Sprint will appear on the board, the other one won't.

Is this expected behavior?
fields.summary: Epic Issuetype Issues Do Not Appear On Boards In GH 6.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6927].
  {panel}

If a user has deleted the original Epic issue type, and deleted all other issue types above Issue ID 6 and then creates a new Issue type (for example Sub Task) so that it has Issue ID 6, Greenhopper will use that new issuetype as the Epic issue type. 

This causes all issues with Issue ID 6 (in the example: subtasks) to appear on the Epic listing on the left of the Scrum board. Even if the user has created a new Epic issue type.

Adding the feature to select which Issue ID is associated with would help resolve this, as to at the moment an SQL query has to be run to change the epic Issue ID.

h3. Workaround
# Backup the instance to XML.
# Install the XML into a test instance.
# Add any missing Issue Types, such as the Epic, Story & Technical Task (this is actually a sub-task) through the browser GUI.
# Execute the following SQL to identify their IDs in the database:
{code:SQL}
select id, pname from issuetype where pname in ('Technical Task','Epic','Story');
{code}
(i) Keep track of these as we'll need them later.
# Add a Story Points Custom Field (Number Field), ensuring to set the context to Epic and Story.
# Add it to the appropriate screens (e.g.: default, however this depends upon JIRA's configuration).
# Use the below SQL to identify the ID:
{code:SQL}
select id from customfield where cfname = 'Story Points';
{code}
# Execute the following SQL to get your GreenHopper property map:
{code:SQL}
select propertyvalue from propertytext where id = (select id from propertyentry where property_key ='SCRUM_DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_CONFIGURATION');
{code}
# Replace the map with the appropriate Story Points Custom Field and Epic, Story & Technical Task Issue Type. For example:
{code:XML}
<map>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.storypoints</string>
    <string>customfield_18008</string> <!-- Changed -->
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.story</string>
    <string>36</string> <!-- Changed -->
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.rankingfield</string>
    <string>customfield_10983</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.labelfield</string>
    <string>customfield_10982</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>FIELDCONFIG_SCHEME_ID</string>
    <long>11141</long>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.task</string>
    <string>3</string> <!-- Changed -->
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.epic</string>
    <string>37</string> <!-- Changed -->
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.businessvalues</string>
    <string>customfield_10985</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>gh.issue.flaggingfield</string>
    <string>customfield_10981</string>
  </entry>
</map>
{code}
(!) Make sure not to include any comments, these are just for reference.
# Stop JIRA.
# Update the map after making the correct changes with the following:
{code:SQL}
update propertytext set propertyvalue = <the updated XML> where id = (select id from propertyentry where property_key ='SCRUM_DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_CONFIGURATION');
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# Install the GreenHopper plugin and reindex JIRA.
# Test by creating a new board and verify all is working.
fields.summary: If another Issue type exists with default Epic ID, Greenhopper treats it as the new Epic.

fields.description:
Switching on sql logging reveals that the custom field ids are queryied over and over again, something which could easily be cached (the id, not the field):

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-12-12 11:33:46,146 http-2990-3 DEBUG admin 693x2069x1 1pl6k6w 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json [greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintCustomFieldServiceImpl] Requesting the Default Sprint field
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-12-12 11:33:46,146 http-2990-3 INFO admin 693x2069x1 1pl6k6w 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json [atlassian.jira.ofbiz.LoggingSQLInterceptor] 0ms Connection taken. borrowed : 2

The total number of selects for a single request alone seems to exceed 60
fields.summary: Investigate SQL query count executed for a single request

fields.description:
When you associate a _Story_ with an _Epic_, if you open the _Story_ details in JIRA, it shows just the epic key in the _Epic Link_ field.

!epic_link.png!

It would be great if we can see the Epic name or at least a link to see the epic details there.
fields.summary: Epic link is showing just the epic key

fields.description:
Apparently when dragging tickets to Epics on new Boards, no native-style JIRA links are created. The linkage between a ticket and it's Epic is only shown through (colored) labels on Board Plan-tab's listing or in Details when a ticket is clicked open and shown on the right.

It would be nice to:

1) Also show the colored label on Work-tab
2) Have JIRA create actual links to Epics (so they would show as any other links)

If (2) is not possible (and why), then we'd want the colored Epic label to be shown under ticket Details at least, when a ticket is clicked open in a new browser tab. Currently, when opening a ticket like this, there is no indication of to which Epic the ticket might belong.
fields.summary: Show related Epic on 'Work' tab and create links to Epic or show Epic label on Details

fields.description: It is very hard to track any changes that have occurred to a board since the last time I've viewed it. If I am continually checking the board for the purpose of observing any changes happening there, GreenHopper doesn't give me a way to see what has changed.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like some indication of WHAT has changed on my board when I perform a board refresh

fields.description: Highly annoying and we should fix this sooner rather than later, as it gives the impression that the refresh notification does nothing.
fields.summary: "Refresh Board" notification does not disappear after Auto-Refresh Board.
